pages.text: Rangea schneiderhoehni comes from the late Ediacaran, with fossils found in the Nama Group, Namibia and White Sea, Russia. It is leaf-shaped petalonamid lifeform that bears a six-fold symmetry, found in shallow waters and could grow up to 10 cm in height, and possibly partook in filter feeding from the surrounding water. Rangea schneiderhoehni holds the title of the first described and named Ediacaran lifeform in the world.
